GRETCHEN WHITMER
LANS ING
ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR DIRECTOR
May 30, 2023
Monique Carter
ARBOR CIRCLE - HOMELESS YOUTH SERVICES
1115 BALL AVE NE,
GRAND RAPIDS, MI, 49505-5904
RE: License#: CB410201176
Dear Monique Carter:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 5/25/2023. The renewal inspection has determined substantial compliance with
applicable licensing statutes and rules. Your license is renewed, and you will be receiving
the license in the mail. It is valid only at your present address and is nontransferable. If
you move, please notify us at least 30 days in advance.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel, at (616) 204-
6992.
Sincerely,
Melinda Gubbins, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
701 S. Elmwood, Ste. 11
Traverse City, MI 49684
(231) 342-3721
enclosure

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• The agency was not in need of technical assistance.
V. CONSULTATION
The facility was offered consultation in the following areas:
• The agency did not request consultation.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The assessment reported the agency did not have any barriers in meeting
licensing requirement during the reporting period. There have been a few
vacancies, however the agency was able to fill the open positions. The Chief
Administrator expressed confidence that the agency will continue to meet licensing
requirements over the next review period.
Financial Overview
Financial records were reviewed and there were no concerns identified.

Staff and Youth Interviews
Interviews were conducted with two staff face-to-face at the agency. Staff reported
they are currently in the process of writing grants to obtain funding. The process
can be somewhat stressful, but the team is working together to ensure the
applications are completed thoroughly and timely. Staff reported feeling supported
by supervision and coworkers and reported no areas of concern.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency maintains sufficient office space, equipment and supplies to ensure
delivery of independent living services. All files were stored securely.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes. It is recommended that the agency be issued a renewal of their
regular license.
_________5/30/2023____________________________
Melinda Gubbins Date
